headline: Blackstone to buy $1 billion Virginia power plant near data centers
summary: (Reuters) -The unit of Blackstone dedicated to investments in the energy industry has agreed to acquire Potomac Energy Center, the asset manager told Reuters on Thursday, in a deal symbolizing the allure to investors of power plants sited near data centers.  Blackstone Energy Transition Partners has agreed to buy the 774-megawatt natural gas-fired power plant in Loudoun County in northern Virginia, according to a statement.  The statement gave no financial details, but sources familiar with the matter said Blackstone is paying around $1 billion for the facility.
